item.description:
This film looks like a roller coaster ride of action, special effects and bad one-liners....right up my alley!  :> 

7:15PM Showtime.  I will be at the theater by 6:15 and we will head in for seats as soon as they let us.  Probably around 6:30.  Please note this is showing in the imax theater downstairs, so please come early.  There is no really convenient gathering spot.  I will be near the ropes by the concession stand, until/unless they let us line up in the inner lobby.  It will be a mad scramble for seats once they let people in, so the group will head in right away.  

As I like to see these movies during opening weekend, it is usually a good idea to buy your tickets ahead of time....especially if it is a big movie with lots of buzz. 

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after.  We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.  If this is not possible because they shoo us out from the downstairs theater, we will also gather on the sidewalk outside for a few minutes also.

Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after and bring cash.

Movie Details:

Release Date:March 9, 2012 (3D/2D theaters and IMAX 3D)
Studio: Walt Disney Pictures
Director: Andrew Stanton
Screenwriter:Andrew Stanton, Mark Andrews, Michael Chabon
Starring:Taylor Kitsch, Lynn Collins, Samantha Morton, Mark Strong, Ciaran Hinds, Dominic West, James Purefoy, Daryl Sabara, Polly Walker, Bryan Cranston, Thomas Hayden Church, Willem Dafoe
Genre:Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi
MPAA Rating: PG-13 (for intense sequences of violence and action)
Official Website: Disney.com/JohnCarter


Plot Summary:From Academy Award®–winning filmmaker Andrew Stanton comes "John Carter"—a sweeping action-adventure set on the mysterious and exotic planet of Barsoom (Mars). "John Carter" is based on a classic novel by Edgar Rice Burroughs, whose highly imaginative adventures served as inspiration for many filmmakers, both past and present. The film tells the story of war-weary, former military captain John Carter (Taylor Kitsch), who is inexplicably transported to Mars where he becomes reluctantly embroiled in a conflict of epic proportions amongst the inhabitants of the planet, including Tars Tarkas (Willem Dafoe) and the captivating Princess Dejah Thoris (Lynn Collins). In a world on the brink of collapse, Carter rediscovers his humanity when he realizes that the survival of Barsoom and its people rests in his hands.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a meetup pin. If the movie is showing upstairs, I will grab a table by the windows at the top of the escalator. If the movie is showing downstairs, I will be near the ropes by the concession stand.
